segment.source: Considered planning of your groups and policies will help you keep them organized and achieve the client behavior that you want.
segment.target: Considered planning of your groups and policies will help you keep them organized and achieve the client behavior that you want.

segment.source: Here are some the recommended practices for organizing and managing your Intune policies and groups.
segment.target: Here are some the recommended practices for organizing and managing your Intune policies and groups.

segment.source: Group basics
segment.target: Group basics

segment.source: Groups in Intune provide great flexibility in managing your devices and users.
segment.target: Groups in Intune provide great flexibility in managing your devices and users.

segment.source: You can set up groups by geographic location, department, hardware characteristics, operating system or based on whether the device is user-owned or company-owned, to suit your organizational needs.
segment.target: You can set up groups by geographic location, department, hardware characteristics, operating system or based on whether the device is user-owned or company-owned, to suit your organizational needs.

segment.source: More information on how to create and manage groups can be found in Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune
segment.target: More information on how to create and manage groups can be found in Use groups to manage users and devices with Microsoft Intune

segment.source: Working with groups
segment.target: Working with groups

segment.source: The default view of the Groups node in the Intune Management console is:
segment.target: The default view of the Groups node in the Intune Management console is:

segment.source: Policies are deployed onto groups, so group hierarchy is one of your key design considerations.
segment.target: Policies are deployed onto groups, so group hierarchy is one of your key design considerations.

segment.source: It is also important to know that a group’s parent group cannot be changed once the group is created, so the design of your groups is critically important from the moment you start using the Intune service.
segment.target: It is also important to know that a group’s parent group cannot be changed once the group is created, so the design of your groups is critically important from the moment you start using the Intune service.

segment.source: Some of the recommended practices for designing a group hierarchy based on your organizational needs are described here.
segment.target: Some of the recommended practices for designing a group hierarchy based on your organizational needs are described here.

segment.source: Keep it simple should be your motto.
segment.target: Keep it simple should be your motto.

segment.source: If your organization does not have specific needs such as those described here, keeping it simple and going with the default group structure and policies will make the service more manageable in the long term.
segment.target: If your organization does not have specific needs such as those described here, keeping it simple and going with the default group structure and policies will make the service more manageable in the long term.

segment.source: Maintenance will be easier if it is possible for you to treat your users equally with little differentiation by group, thereby having to maintain fewer policies.
segment.target: Maintenance will be easier if it is possible for you to treat your users equally with little differentiation by group, thereby having to maintain fewer policies.

segment.source: All users and devices in your organization
segment.target: All users and devices in your organization

segment.source: You should have a parent group defined for all users and devices in your organization, as you are likely to have policies that will apply to all.
segment.target: You should have a parent group defined for all users and devices in your organization, as you are likely to have policies that will apply to all.

segment.source: This can be the default All Users and All devices groups in Intune.
segment.target: This can be the default All Users and All devices groups in Intune.

segment.source: These groups can then be used to apply policies that are applicable to all users and devices within your organization.
segment.target: These groups can then be used to apply policies that are applicable to all users and devices within your organization.

segment.source: If you are creating BYOD (bring your own device), Corporate Owned (CO) groups, then those groups can be the children of the All Users and All devices parent groups.
segment.target: If you are creating BYOD (bring your own device), Corporate Owned (CO) groups, then those groups can be the children of the All Users and All devices parent groups.

segment.source: BYOD and corporate owned devices
segment.target: BYOD and corporate owned devices

segment.source: If your organizational policy permits the usage of BYOD (bring your own device), Corporate Owned (CO) devices or a combination of both, then we recommend that you apply policies based on those two categories of devices.
segment.target: If your organizational policy permits the usage of BYOD (bring your own device), Corporate Owned (CO) devices or a combination of both, then we recommend that you apply policies based on those two categories of devices.

segment.source: In the case of BYOD or a mix, policies should be carefully planned and designed in order not to infringe on local privacy regulations.
segment.target: In the case of BYOD or a mix, policies should be carefully planned and designed in order not to infringe on local privacy regulations.

segment.source: This will also help employees understand the corporate management of their personal devices and may drive more towards application-level management rather than device-level management.
segment.target: This will also help employees understand the corporate management of their personal devices and may drive more towards application-level management rather than device-level management.
